item.title: Exploring the effects of Covid on Austin's housing supply
item.description: Exploring the effects of construction delays from Covid on the Austin housing market This project was put together from the Issued Construction Permits dataset assembled and maintained by the City of Austin. When my current apartment lease was up for renewal this October, the market seemed to have changed dramatically from a year ago when buildings were offering large lease signing incentives in order to fill units. At the same time, I noticed an abundance of new construction going on around the city, so I was curious if the market mechanisms that normally keep housing supply in line with demand had been supressed by building delays from supply shortages and personnel regulations during peak Covid pandemic.
